meanings.definition: A person who duns or demands payment.
meanings.sent1: The dunned kept asking for the money owed.
meanings.sent2: The shop owner hired a dunner to collect overdue bills.
meanings.sent3: The dunned had a reputation for being persistent but fair.
meanings.sent4: The dunner's voice echoed like a broken record.
meanings.sent5: The image of the dunner knocking on doors stayed in my mind.

meanings.definition: To make repeated and insistent demands for payment.
meanings.sent1: He would dun his clients until they paid up.
meanings.sent2: She decided to dun the customer who had been avoiding payment.
meanings.sent3: The vendor would dun playfully, but the message was clear.
meanings.sent4: The rain continued to dun on the roof all night.
meanings.sent5: The teacher would dun the students for their homework diligently.

meanings.sent1: The dunner of the distant thunder could be heard.
meanings.sent2: The dunner of the drum reverberated through the room.
meanings.sent3: The dunner of the old engine made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The dunner of the fireworks filled the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The dunner of the waterfall was soothing to listen to.
